comments.body: You could restrict the type to `type: 11 | 22`, although this will require a cast from users who aren't passing consts or literals. (Something like `dht(n, m as 11 | 22)`)
Neat, didn't know you could do that, but I think I prefer to keep away casts in case someone is using a variable to feed in, e.g. a config scenario that selects the matching number.
